result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Satin Leetrice Roberts

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Satin Leetrice Roberts in court.  Attorney Sarah Zwach in court for Satin Leetrice Roberts.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  Court grants requests. Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 3 Supervision.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court, defendant Satin Leetrice Roberts not in court, in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Both parties agreed that a signature bond would be appropriate.  GRANTED by the Court, Signature Bond Set at $500.00 with a Level 3 Supervision.  Attorney Megan Kaldunski informs court that she has taken another position and requested to be withdrawn from case.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the court.  Attorney Megan Kaldunski advised the court that attorney Sarah Zwach will be taking over case.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court, defendant Satin Leetrice Roberts not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Satin Leetrice Roberts in court with Attorney Megan Kaldunski.  Defendant Satin Leetrice Roberts in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Judge Franke.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Satin Leetrice Roberts not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appears in person the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Kaldunski has a motion hearing in another court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Leobardo C. III
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring: NO CONTACT ORDER.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Satin Leetrice Roberts in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Satin Leetrice Roberts in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Satin Leetrice Roberts appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
